questions.text: A _____ defines what must take place, not how it will be accomplished.
questions.explanation: Logical design specifies what the system must do functionally, leaving implementation details to the physical design phase.

questions.text: After completing integration testing, a systems analyst must perform _____, which involves the entire information system and includes all typical processing situations.
questions.explanation: System testing validates that all components work together as a complete, functional system under realistic conditions.

questions.text: Compared with character-based formats, a ______ offers a more efficient storage method.
questions.explanation: Binary formats store data in compact numerical representations, saving space and improving processing speed.

questions.text: In an entity-relationship diagram, entities are commonly represented as _____.
questions.explanation: Entities in ER diagrams are represented as rectangles that identify objects or concepts within the database.

questions.text: _____ is the process of creating table designs by assigning specific fields or attributes to each table in a database.
questions.explanation: Normalization organizes data to reduce redundancy and ensure data integrity across related tables.

questions.text: _____ measures actual system performance under specific circumstances and is affected by network loads and hardware efficiency.
questions.explanation: Throughput refers to the number of transactions processed within a given time period under real conditions.

questions.text: A _____ is a formal reference point that measures system characteristics at a specific time.
questions.explanation: A baseline serves as a fixed point for comparison when assessing system changes or improvements.

questions.text: In terms of system maintenance management, _____ means examining the whole to learn about the individual elements.
questions.explanation: Analysis breaks down systems into their components to better understand how each part functions.

questions.text: _____ is the overall time between a request for system activity and the delivery of the response.
questions.explanation: Response time measures how long a system takes to respond to a user's action or request.

questions.text: _____ graphically represents the logical rules and interaction between program modules using a series of symbols connected by arrows.
questions.explanation: Flowcharts visually depict program logic, showing the flow of control between processes.

questions.text: The _____ changeover method allows the new system to be implemented in stages, or modules.
questions.explanation: Phased operation introduces system components gradually, reducing risk during implementation.

questions.text: During _____, programmers must test programs that interact with other programs and files separately before they are integrated into the system.
questions.explanation: Unit testing ensures each program or component works correctly before integration.

questions.text: Testing two or more programs that depend on each other is called _____.
questions.explanation: Integration testing validates data flow and interaction between dependent software modules.

questions.text: The environment for the actual system operation is called the _____.
questions.explanation: The production environment hosts the live, fully functional version of the system used by end users.

questions.text: Which of the following is specified by the detailed procedures in a test plan?
options: The result of the final test of all programs
How a separate operational and test environment is prepared
The test data to be used during the test plan
Who will work with the new system and ensure that all necessary features have been included
questions.correctAnswer: The test data to be used during the test plan
questions.explanation: A test plan outlines specific data inputs, expected results, and test cases for evaluation.

questions.text: The main objective of _____ is to avoid problems or to identify them as soon as possible.
questions.explanation: Quality assurance aims to prevent defects by maintaining standards throughout system development.

questions.text: _____ measures a module's scope and processing characteristics.
questions.explanation: Cohesion assesses how closely related the functions within a module are.

questions.text: _____ is the process of putting a new information system online and retiring the old system.
questions.explanation: System changeover transitions operations from the old system to the new one, marking go-live.

questions.text: To avoid problems, preventive maintenance _____.
options: Adds enhancements to an operational system and makes the system easier to use
Diagnoses and corrects errors in an operational system
Involves changing an operational system to make it more efficient, reliable, or maintainable
Requires analysis of areas where trouble is likely to occur
questions.correctAnswer: Requires analysis of areas where trouble is likely to occur
questions.explanation: Preventive maintenance anticipates potential issues to avoid future system failures.

questions.text: _____ prevents unauthorized users from creating, modifying, or deleting information.
questions.explanation: Integrity ensures information remains accurate and unaltered except by authorized users.

questions.text: A(n) _____ is an attack that takes advantage of a vulnerability.
questions.explanation: An exploit leverages system vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access or perform malicious actions.

questions.text: A _____ is responsible for assigning maintenance tasks to individuals or to a maintenance team.
questions.explanation: System administrators oversee maintenance scheduling, task assignment, and system operations.

questions.text: A _____ is a security weakness or soft spot.
questions.explanation: A vulnerability is a flaw in software or systems that attackers can exploit to compromise security.
